div.p:
In the Name of God Amen. This ninth day of January ano. One thousand
Six hundred and seventy five and in the 44th year of the Dominion of the right
honorable [Cecilius] absolute Lord and proprietor of the province of Maryland I Thomas
[Mathens] of Charles County in the province of aforesaid [Gentry?] being sick and weake
in body but of sound and perfect memory praise be to god for the same and
Knowing the uncertainty of this life and being
the uncertainty of this life and being desirous to sell things in order doe
make this my last will and testament in manner and form following that is to say
first and principally I comend my soule to god my creator believing that
I shall recieve full pardon and of all my sins and be saved by the
precious Death and merits of our beloved Savior and reademer Christ Jesus
and my body to the earth from where it came to be buried in such decent and
Christian manner as to my Execturos thereafter named shall be thought and
Convenient and as touching such wordle Estate as god hath lent me my will
and meaning is the same shall be imformed and bestowed as hereafter by this
my will is exchanged and first and principally. I do will and require that all
my Just Debts be truly satisfied discharged and paid and I doe hereby revoke
renounce frustrait and make void all wills by me formely made ad declare
and appoint this my last will and testament.
